result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Christopher W Fox was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Testimony taken.  Direct exam by ADA Karst.   Exhibit #1 marked and identified and offered.  Atty Breun objects - reasons outlined on record.  Argument by ADA Karst.  Court will admit Exhibit #1.  Witness identified defn.   Venue established.  Cross-exam by Atty Breun.  Evidence closed.  ADA moves for bindover.  Atty Bruen objects to bindover, but waives argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds case over for further proceedings with Br 7.  Info filed, copy given defn, reading waived   Plea of NG and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect entered.  Motons due 20 days.  Bail continued.   Atty Breun raised issue of bail.  BMP went to speak with defn, and the jail would not give the defn a pen to sign the documents.   Court states that she does not have any written motion to amend the conditions of bail.  Court recommends Atty Breun raising this issue with Br 7.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: for Treatment (incompetency)
Exhibit #1 marked, offered and rec'd.

ADA Corey Stephan for State in person; Attorney Laura Breun for defendant in person; Defendant Christopher Fox in person from DCJ.  
ADA moved court to ask defn if he is competent.  All parties have a copy of Dr's report.  Defn states he is competent.   Court finds defn competent unless ADA can prove he is not.  ADA believes his burden is clear and convincing.  Atty Breun agrees.  Dr. E.K. duly sworn and testified.  Direct exam by ADA Stephan.  Qualifications outlined on record.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and rec'd.  Dr. believes defn lacks substantial capacity to assist in his defense.  Dr. believes defn is likely to be restored to competency within statutory time period.  Cross-exam by Atty Breun.  Questions by court by Judge Smith.  ADA moves court to make finding that pursuant to 971.14(4)(b) that the State has proven that the defendant is incompetent.  Atty Bruen argues that defendant is competent.    Atty Breun also argues that the court refer defn to outpatient restoration program.  Court reaffirms probable cause finding of 2/18/2014.  Court finds that defn is incompetent at this time but is likely to become competent within statutory time frame.  Court finds there is not adequate info regarding medication.  Court suspends proceedings and commits defn to DHS for an indeterminate term.  Defn to receive sentence credit.  Court orders DHS shall designate receiving  mental health institute.  Institute to rexamine defn at 3, 6, 9, and 30 days prior to expiration of commitment.  Court finds defn is capable of making medication decisions.    Sentence credit from 2/11/14-3/17/14 - 35 days.  Court does not know what authority the court has to set bail.  ADA believes case is suspended and agrees.  Atty Breun states she has had a client before that has been ordered to Outpatient Restoration Program.  Atty Breun states she spoke with a SW and states there is an apartment available and deposit already paid.  Court still does not know what authority she has.  Atty Breun will look into it.   ADA believes premature to make any bail decisions at this point.  Court declines to change bail at this time.
Atty Laura Breun
from Erik D Knudson, MD for Christopher W Fox
Atty Laura Breun appointed 2/14/14
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing filed.

Per Atty Breun, defn under Chapter 51 commitment and taking medication.  Atty Believes defn understands what is going on.  Statements by defn.  Atty Breun raised competency of defn.  Atty Stephan does not dispute request.  Court finds competency has been properly raised.  Court finds probable cause on the complaint.  Court orders exam take place, outpatient, to occur in 30 day time frame.   Court to send notice.   Proceedings suspended until competency eval filed.
